item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road Release Date Revealed, Switch 2 Version Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/inazuma-eleven-victory-road-release-date

Level-5 has finally announced what we can only hope will be the final Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road release date, and a Switch 2 version of the game has also been confirmed.

Over on its official website, Level-5 says Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is coming on August 21st. The game was previously slated for a June release, but Level-5 says it needs more time to "further polish the game and deliver the best possible experience".

Additionally, while the game was originally set to come to mobile platforms as well as PC and consoles, the iOS and Android versions of Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road have seemingly been dropped. However, it's now coming not only to Switch 2, but to Xbox Series X|S as well.

The game is also still planned to release for the original Nintendo Switch, so don't worry; if you're a Nintendo fan, you won't need the newest console, which launches on June 5th, to play Victory Road.

What's more, Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road will feature full cross-play and cross-progression, so if you've bought the game on Switch but you want to continue playing on PlayStation, you should be able to use the same save to do so.

More trailers for Victory Road are also set to debut in the coming months. In May, a making-of trailer will show you how Level-5 created the game, while in June, you'll get a new story trailer. At the end of July, a final trailer will preface the release of Victory Road in August.

It's been a long road for Level-5 and Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road. The game was originally announced in 2016 and was set for a 2018 release, but it was delayed to 2020, then again to 2021 after a name change.

A Western version of Victory Road was confirmed in 2023, and a PC version was subsequently announced in December that same year. Here's hoping that no further delays or platform changes are on the way and that we can now look forward to playing the game at last.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is set to launch on PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and Nintendo consoles on August 21st.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero Version 1.7 Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/zenless-zone-zero-version-17-release-date

HoYoverse has revealed the release date for Zenless Zone Zero Version 1.7, with the latest update for the gacha action RPG due to end the first season later this month.

Arriving on April 23rd, Version 1.7 follows on from March's Version 1.6, and HoYoverse says it'll mark "the grand finale of Zenless Zone Zero Season One". The story will revolve around the Sacrifice crisis; you'll "finally reveal the long-sought truth" behind the crisis and learn more about two new characters as well.

Both of those characters, Vivian and Hugo, will be available as S-Rank agents, and it sounds like they'll be heavily involved in the climactic story of this update as well.

The first S-Rank agent, Vivian, is an Ether Anomaly Agent who uses her parasol and rapier to shift "seamlessly" between ground attacks and aerial combat. She can also amplify Anomaly damage and boost her team's Corruption damage.

Hugo, meanwhile, is an S-Rank Ice Attack Agent who uses a suitcase that transforms into a scythe. How very Gungrave. He can increase his damage based on enemies' stun duration, and he's got a pretty good area-of-effect game as well.

This version's banners will also bring back Jane and Lighter for reruns, so if you missed your chance to recruit them both to your team when they debuted, you'll have another shot at doing so now.

According to HoYoverse, Zenless Zone Zero Version 1.7 will also provide opportunities to "unwind or embrace new challenges through in-game events" like the new "Say It With Flowers" shop management minigame.

If you prefer a more thrilling challenge, the return of Bangboo Bash, which sees you participating in "obstacle and survival courses" to earn exclusive rewards, is also making a return in this Version cycle.

Zenless Zone Zero Version 1.7 arrives on April 23rd. The game is available to play for free right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and mobile devices.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Mafia: The Old Country Release Date Seemingly Leaked Via Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/mafia-old-country-release-date-seemingly-leaked

The Mafia: The Old Country release date may have been leaked by a now-amended Steam blog post, if a new report is to be believed.

According to the folks at Insider Gaming, a post was recently uploaded to the game's Steam page in which an upcoming PAX livestream was highlighted. The livestream will be aired in early May, and it's aiming to celebrate the 23-year lifespan of the Mafia series.

At the bottom of the post, a release date of August 8th was apparently listed. I say "apparently", because the same post has since been scrubbed of that information, although the promo for the PAX livestream remains.

At the moment, Mafia: The Old Country simply has a broad release window of "2025" listed, and it would make sense if a full release date was announced during a retrospective of the Mafia series as a whole. We'll probably have to wait until May for confirmation, though.

If you're not familiar with Mafia: The Old Country, it's the latest entry in the Mafia series, which so far consists of three mainline entries (not counting remakes like Mafia: Definitive Edition, that is).

Although the games are technically open-world sandbox affairs, they're usually much more focused on their narratives than on freeform gameplay, so you might want to put comparisons to Grand Theft Auto out of your mind.

The Old Country is the series' first game not to be set after the previous one, chronologically speaking; instead, it's a prequel taking place in 1900s Sicily, where you'll play as indentured laborer Enzo Favara as he seeks a better life for himself.

Assuming this leak is correct, you'll be able to get your hands on Mafia: The Old Country on August 8th, when it'll launch for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

item.title: Streets of Rage Finally Hits Nintendo Switch Online, Plus Two More Genesis Games
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/streets-of-rage-nintendo-switch-online

Nintendo has added three more Sega Genesis games to its Nintendo Switch Online library, and one of them is one of the most celebrated beat-'em-up games of its generation.

Having already brought the likes of ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron, super-hard platformer Ghouls 'n Ghosts, and side-scroller Altered Beast to the Switch Online Genesis lineup, the first game in today's haul is another bona fide classic.

That's right: none other than Streets of Rage is making its Nintendo Switch Online debut. You might think you've already played this one on the service, but in fact, you've played the 1992 sequel Streets of Rage 2, which was, until today, the only Streets of Rage game on Switch Online.

Of course, it's not just about Streets of Rage, so if you've never been of the side-scrolling beat-'em-up persuasion, don't worry; there are two more games that might tickle your fancy.

The first of these is Super Thunder Blade, a Space Harrier-slash-Star Fox-style shooter with some impressive (if somewhat hard to look at in the year of our lord 2025) visual effects.

Lastly, today's Genesis haul brings ESWAT: City Under Siege to Switch Online. It's a side-scroller, but it's a shooter with more in common with the likes of Super Turrican or the Contra series than with Streets of Rage.

All three of these games are available right now with a Nintendo Switch Online membership, although you will have to pick up the Expansion Pack addon if you want to play them.

These Switch Online games come at a time when Nintendo is gearing up to release the Switch 2, the successor to the original Switch (if the name didn't already give that away).

The console is due to launch on June 5th, although pre-orders in the US and Canada have been delayed due to the former's President Donald Trump imposing sweeping economic tariffs on various countries and economic bodies around the world.

With that being said, Trump subsequently issued a 90-day pause for those tariffs in all countries but China, so there's every possibility that we'll get a new pre-order date for the Switch 2 sometime soon. While we wait, you can check out these three new Genesis games on Switch Online right now if you've got the Expansion Pack.

item.title: Asmodee Group Announces Catan Sixth Edition Is Out Now
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/asmodee-group-announces-catan-sixth-edition-is-out-now

A brand new edition of Catan is now available. The aptly named Catan Sixth Edition, is the first significant evolution of the iconic strategy game since 2015, bringing a streamlined and more accessible experience to players worldwide.

The Catan Sixth Edition Announcement

In an official press release, Catan Studio announced the changes coming to Catan Sixth Edition. Generally, the core gameplay that made Catan a pop culture and tabletop gaming staple is still here. Gathering resources, trading among friends, getting into small arguments over wood and sheep, etc..

The latest version of the game will sport a new look. It will feature brighter box art alongside updated components and packaging. it isn't as elaborate as the Catan Masterpiece Kickstarter, but it is a modest upgrade nonetheless.

These new components will be part of Catan Sixth Edition's more eco-friendly design. Box trays have been redesigned to be more environmentally conscious, and the box will contain fewer plastic pieces. The box also has expanded storage, allowing it to accommodate the 5-6 Player Extension Pack. This doesn't mean the base box can contain all expansions, but it is a start.

On that topic, Catan Sixth Edition will have several expansions. These include Seafarers, Cities & Knights, and the aforementioned 5-6 Player Extension Pack.

Lastly, the game will feature more inclusive, user-friendly design elements. The game's artwork will portray more diverse character illustrations. The newly textured hex tiles and premium card trays will provide a more tactile play experience. Finally, the updated rulebook will contain streamlined rules alongside visual examples, helping more players understand the core experience.

“For CATAN’s 6th edition, we aimed to enhance the player experience while preserving the game’s core mechanics," said Benjamin Teuber, managing director and game designer at CATAN GmbH. "With updated packaging, refreshed artwork, and a streamlined rulebook, we’re honoring our father’s legacy while making the game more approachable for new and longtime players alike."

Catan Sixth Edition is available right now. The base game is being sold at an MSRP of $49.99. The Seafarers expansion is available at an MSRP of $49.99, and the Cities & Knights expansion is available at an MSRP of $54.99.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This… More about Tyler
